column1: fullish outside off, gets on the front foot to ease the ball to the right of cover point. A bit of outswing for Southee, as always
once again Southee goes full, searching for swing. It curls in towards off stump and Tiwary plays a checked drive to mid-off
low full-toss on off stump, punched to the left of mid-on
looks to straighten his line a touch and ends up overdoing it, slides it down the leg side - no swing this time

good ball, on the fullish side of a good length, angling into off stump - no swing again. Rahane works it away to the left of square leg, playing dangerously around his front pad, and Buttler chases back to make a scrambling save near the rope

length ball on middle and off, stays in the crease and pushes softly towards short extra cover and calls Rahane through for the single. Rahane starts a touch late, but the single is easily completed in the end
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-on
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point with an open bat face
short and wide, but it's a slower ball and Tiwary doesn't pick it. Slashes with no footwork and the ball drops under his bat and bounces through to the keeper
back of a length, closer to off stump this time, guided down to third man
back of a length, a tiny bit of shape in towards off and middle. Rahane thinks about whipping it into the leg side, chooses the conservative option in the end and defends down into the pitch

fuller, wider, but not full enough for the flat-bat loft over the covers. He throws his bat at it, ends up slicing it high in the air off the outside half of his bat, and Krunal Pandya comes in from third man to take a simple catch
short ball outside off, and again Tiwary's feet are rooted as he slashes at it. Extra bounce takes it past his edge
shortish outside off, stabbed away towards deep point, moving to his left. Interesting field placing, tells you Southee wants to keep the ball as wide of Smith's off stump as possible
full, slanting across Tiwary, who plays an open-faced drive that slices away through a misfielding backward point fielder
fuller now, fifth-stump line, driven to short extra cover

uh oh. That was shortish and fairly wide, and Smith plays an angled-bat slash and gets an inside edge that screams away to the left of a diving Parthiv Patel. He gets a bit of glove to it, so you could call it a drop, harshly
and again. This one's a bit wider, and the inside edge is a little thicker, and it bounces down and goes further to the left of Parthiv, and runs away to the fine leg boundary once again
that's too wide, on a length, and Smith can get on the front foot and slash it away a fair distance to the right of the deep point fielder
shortish outside off, poked away to backward point

gone, is it? No, it isn't. Jasprit Bumrah makes a mess of a fairly simple catch at mid-on. Another short ball, angling into Tiwary this time, and he's late on the pull as it hurries onto him, and the ball pops up softly off the high part of the bat. Bumrah mistimes his jump, the ball ricochets up off his palm, and he can't get it on the rebound either, diving desperately to his left
length ball outside off, and Smith walks all the way across to clip it crisply to the midwicket boundary
bouncer outside off, Smith can't time the tennis smash as well as he'd like, and it bounces down to mid-on
bouncer, too much width outside off, and Smith leans back to uppercut it into the stands to the right of third man
short outside off, and Bumrah's travails continue. Smith pulls it, and the man at mid-on fluffs up a simple fielding effort, letting the ball slip through for three unearned runs
quickish length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
sees Smith backing away to make room to hit through the off side and fires it at his pads. Smith can't put bat to ball
length ball, at the batsman, pushed down to long-off
a bit of flight on off stump, slogged along the ground to long-on
fired into Smith's pads again and he flicks it away, in the air. I'm not sure he timed it 100% as well as he wanted, but it still soars away over the square leg boundary
length ball on middle and leg, swiped to midwicket
and he has to duck after bowling his first ball. It's a length ball on off stump and Tiwary clears his front leg and clubs it fiercely past his ducking head
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the off side
slower ball, follows the batsman as he looks to make himself room, and he swipes at it and pops it in the air, just wide of the diving McClenaghan, moving backwards and to his left from mid-on
yorker, squeezed into the leg side
low full-toss on off stump, and once again he clears his front leg and flat-bats it between bowler and mid-on
slower ball, back of a length on leg stump. Bit of an offcutter, and Tiwary wants to work it into the leg side but realises he's going against the turn, and ends up poking it back towards the bowler
back of a length on off stump, makes room and slaps to sweeper cover
sees him looking to make room and fires it wide of off stump, too wide
wide again, not as wide this time, and Tiwary uses all the swinging room to get down on one knee and slog-sweep over wide long-on
full-toss on off stump, whipped away to the left of long-on
quickish length ball on the pads, Tiwary can't bring his bat around to clip it through the leg side
full-toss again, and he clears his front leg once more to clout it over a leaping deep midwicket fielder

fullish on middle stump and Tiwary slogs it away again, to the right of Harbhajan Singh at deep square leg. He didn't have to move too far, and he makes a mess of a fairly straightforward stop at the rope
starts with a length ball, starts with a length ball down the leg side
short on off stump, and Smith is on his back foot in an instant, swivelling on his back toe to pull it fiercely over midwicket
slower length ball outside off, poked into the covers. He wants the single but Rohit moves quickly to his left from extra cover to deny him
sees Smith coming down the track and bowls a wide length ball. Smith slaps it to the man at deep point
shortish, lots of width, slapped away, but he's got a man sweeping on the cover point boundary for exactly that kind of ball
slower ball, back of a length outside off, and Krunal dives to his left at backward point to stop the ball after Smith uses his hands brilliantly to slice it wide of him
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point
tossed up outside off, drops onto a good length, driven to long-off
sees him coming and bowls it very full, and he can only jab it down quietly into the midwicket region
flat length ball on off stump, clipped to deep midwicket
looks to make Tiwary reach for the ball, ends up bowling too wide of off stump
back of a length outside off, chopped away to the right of extra cover
length ball outside off, a bit slower. Smith uses his wrists to work it down to long-on
length ball wide of off, flat-batted to the right of extra cover
sees him stepping out and bowls a slower one at his legs. Clipped down to long-on

back of a length outside off, and Smith's attempted dab ends up going too fine. He was looking at the fine third man region, and ends up finding the keeper's gloves. Parthiv read the play well and took a step to his right before he dived
shortish outside off, and that's some steep bounce to beat the edge of his attempted stab through point
a bit more width and Buttler dives to his left at backward point to stop a well-struck cut
once again a bit of width, and once again Buttler dives to his left to stop Handscomb's cut
again short, not as much width, but Handscomb creates some by stepping away from the line of the ball, and slaps it to the man at deep point
tossed up outside off and Handscomb skips out to drive to long-off
sees him step out and bowls it shorter and wide outside off. Slapped to sweeper cover
down the track again as Harbhajan offers a bit of loop outside off, plays a wristy drive down to long-off

fetches the shortish ball from wide of off stump and pulls into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on. The two fielders converge, and Rayudu, running from deep midwicket and diving to his right, pushes the ball past Southee coming in the other direction. Harbhajan yells at Rayudu, and he yells back. Harbhajan goes all the way to the fielder to comfort him, but Rayudu is still seething
full outside leg, swept off the bottom edge to short fine leg
full outside off, squeezed away through point
skips out of his crease and Southee shortens his length a touch. Handscomb clips to mid-on
short outside off, and Handscomb squeezes the cut past the diving Buttler at backward point - in fact off his fingertips, as he dived when he may not have needed to
yorker on middle stump, jabbed to short cover
short on off stump, pulled to the left of deep midwicket, and Hardik attacks the ball aggressively to keep it down to one
shortish outside off, cut away again and it's too close to Buttler this time
full on off stump, whipped to mid-on, who's right on the edge of the circle, allowing the easy single

flat length ball on off stump, and it's perhaps a touch quicker than Handscomb would like as he reaches out to sweep it. He's not able to far enough forward to get on top of the ball, and it bounces, takes his top edge, and finds the man at deep square leg
back of a length on middle and off, worked away through square leg
back of a length on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, pushed to short extra cover
flat and quick on leg stump, clipped to backward square leg
slightly slower outside off, just short of driving length. Dhoni waits and pushes to long-off
fullish length ball, wide outside off, and Dhoni uses the swinging room to flat-bat it back over the bowler's head. Bam.
back of a length close to off stump, punched into the covers
shortish outside off, angling into the batsman. Dhoni lets it come on and dabs it softly into the point region
back of a length on middle stump, cramps the batsman for room, and he blocks it back to the bowler. He was opening up at the hips, looking for something he could club into the leg side

again he clears his front leg and McClenaghan hurries him with a quick short ball at his body. He's late on the pull, and the ball pops up softly, over the umpire, and bounces down to the right of mid-on
back of a length on middle stump, Dhoni can't quite time the nurdle off his hips and McClenaghan sprints through in his follow-through to stop the single into the vacant leg side infield
in the blockhole on off and middle, clipped gently into the leg side
fired in flat from wide of the crease, ends up firing it down the leg side
back of a length on off stump, a little slower, and Dhoni opens out to flat-bat to long-on
quickish, back of a length, wide of off. Not short enough to cut and he has to reach out as well, and he inside-edges it down into the pitch
wide again, but fuller, and Tiwary reaches out to stab into the covers and bring up his half-century
full and quick on off stump, driven to long-off

down the track and he converts this quickish full ball into a full-toss, flat-bats it hard down the ground and Pollard covers a lot of ground to his left from long-off and dives to stop it close to the boundary
fullish on off stump. Dhoni clears his front leg and flat-bats to mid-off
back of a length, angling into the batsman, and it sneaks past the inside edge as he looks to pull - wasn't short enough for it, and doesn't miss the top of the stumps by much
back of a length again, outside off this time, and the ball sneaks below Dhoni's attempted slash
fuller, a touch too full for Dhoni to get under the big hit over the leg side, and he swipes along the ground to deep midwicket
wide yorker, left alone because Tiwary couldn't have done much with it, and the umpire decides it was wide enough to call a wide
shortish outside off, swatted away to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, driven past the bowler to long-off
short, leg-stumpish, bad ball considering fine leg is inside the circle, and Dhoni steps across to help it away - it was off the glove, actually - to the right of the fielder

short on middle stump. Dhoni jumps to work it off his hip through square leg. He slips while turning at the end of his first run, but gets up very quickly, sees that the fielder still has a bit of ground to cover, and sprints through for the second
back of a length at the hips, and this time fine leg is back. Dhoni glances very fine, and Bumrah sprints to his right and puts in a slide to stop it near the rope
slower short ball outside off, pulled away through backward square leg
close to the blockhole outside off, looks to swipe it down the ground, can't really middle it, and Southee falls to his right in his follow-through to stop the ball
full-toss speared across the left-hander, wide outside off, flat-batted over the bowler's head, not very hard, and long-on runs to his right to stop it
shortish, angling in from wide of the crease. Dhoni makes a bit of room to jab it into the point region
slower ball at the legs. Tiwary slogs at it, miscues it high in the air, and it drops between the converging bowler and long-on

slower ball, shorter this time, following Tiwary's movement away from the leg stump. Tiwary has been visibly tiring over the last few overs, and he didn't have the strength left to muscle a slower ball over the man stationed at deep midwicket. Hits it straight into his lap
back of a length close to off stump. Dhoni shuffles across and works it through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on to steer it to the right of backward point
lovely slower ball, turning like an offbreak towards middle stump, and Perera can't take the risk of slogging against the break. Lets it come on and dabs it away towards short third man
wide yorker. Perera can't get across far enough to lap it towards fine leg, and the ball sneaks through to the keeper
wide and full again, angling away from the left-hander. He's cleared his front leg too early, and has to reach across too far, and can only leave it in the end
wide outside off again, shorter, and maybe the change in length increases the angle away from Perera far enough for the umpire to call it wide

bouncer, Perera has to fetch the pull from outside off, against a shoulder-high ball, and top-edges it safely between Rayudu at deep midwicket and Harbhajan at deep square leg. Rayudu makes the sliding stop, Harbhajan fetches the ball and throws
full outside off again, stabbed into the covers
shortish, angling into off stump, pulled away to deep midwicket
another wide yorker, and all Perera can do is jab it to extra cover
full outside off, swiped to long-on
shortish on off stump, pulled in the air, and Rayudu comes quickly off the deep midwicket boundary to take a simple catch
slower short ball, and Tiwary is through his pull too soon and the ball hits him on the ribs
in the blockhole outside off, jabbed down the ground towards long-on
slower short ball wide outside off, flat-batted to long-off

another slower ball, but this time Perera holds his shape, doesn't swing too early, and even though his bottom hand comes off the handle, he still manages to connect well enough with his pull to clear the square leg boundary comfortably
back of a length and some gentle swing outside off, tapped towards point
good length and just a shade outside off, Rohit drops it defensively in front of cover
back of a length and swigs back in, cramping the batsman for room. Jabbed towards midwicket as Rohit gets off the mark
shortish and width outside off, Parthiv leans back and cuts it to backward point. Rahana dives full-length to his left to stop the ball. He takes a high-five from Steven Smith
even shorter and outside off, Parthiv stands tall and gets on top of the bounce. Punched to the right of cover. The fielder dives over the ball
straying into the pads, clipped to fine leg
loose full ball down the leg side, Parthiv helps it to the right of leg-slip for four
dug in on middle, punchily defended down the ground
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, Parthiv stands tall and punches back to Dinda
shorter and just a shade outside off, cramps Parthiv for space. Chopped tamely to the covers
Dinda goes full and straight, flicked to square leg. Parthiv sets off for a single but is sent back. M Ashwin can't nail a direct hit
overpitched on middle, Parthiv stretches forward and drives it firmly to mid-on
length ball close to off stump, dabbed into the point region
back of a length on off stump, it wasn't exactly a short ball, but it was short enough for Rohit, simply got his front leg out of the way and swatted it over midwicket
short again, outside off this time. Rohit looks for that front-foot pull again, fetching it from outside off, and ends up top-edging it to the third man boundary
length ball on off and middle, clipped to midwicket

and another. This one's fuller, offering some room outside off stump, and Rohit throws his bat at it, aiming over the covers, and gets a thick edge that flies to the third man boundary. Third man had come into the circle just before that ball
length ball on middle, clipped away through square leg
back of a length, a bit of movement into the left-hander to cramp him for room, and he manages to flap that pull away through square leg
yorker, a bit of swerve into middle stump. Parthiv manages to get his pad out of the way and jam his bat down on it
this time he goes for the wide short ball angled away from the left-hander, ends up bowling it too wide. Parthiv can't connect with the slash
in the blockhole on off stump, and Parthiv gets a full face behind it, the bat is perfectly vertical on impact, and it races away between the stumps and the non-striker
length ball wide of off stump, and he loves width, just flays it away through cover point
short, wide, cracked away, went like a flash to the left of backward point
fuller now, a little closer to off stump. Parthiv throws his bat at an angled-bat slap, looking to hit through the covers, and gets a thick edge that Dhoni collects with a dive to his left
fullish on off stump, clipped to the left of midwicket, who makes a diving stop
length ball on middle stump, clipped to square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed into the point region

full, straight, and that's an excellent change of length to Rohit, who often gets into a tangle with his front pad planted across the stumps. Plays around it, misses, and there's a big appeal for lbw, but it's sliding down leg
back of a length, angling into off and middle, defended into the covers

that's not a short ball, it's probably only marginally short of a good length. It's on off stump. And Rohit, maybe he's set himself up for this ball, just clears his front leg and pulls it to the square leg boundary
length ball outside off, eased into the cover point region
a bit wider and he throws his bat at it, the top edge drops short of third man as he runs around to his left
back of a length on off stump, worked through square leg
back of a length outside off, Rayudu opens his bat face to dab towards wide slip
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length outside off, dabbed to the left of backward point
back of a length on off stump, poked away towards backward point
back of a length slower ball outside off, squeezed to short third man with an open bat face
back of a length close to off stump, Rohit uses his wrists to poke it back to the bowler
slower ball on off and middle. Rohit waits and punches to long-on
slower legcutter close to off stump. Rayudu gets forward, but moves his front leg away from the ball, looking for that dab towards third man again, and the away movement beats his outside edge
this time he executes the same shot better, dabs to the right of short third man
length ball on off stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length on off stump, flat, punched to long-on
a bit of loop, but quick loop outside off and Rayudu comes forward to clip down the ground. Ashwin moves quickly to his right to cut off the single
a little fuller, and Rayudu uses his wrists to play it down to long-on, gets it past the diving Ashwin this time
fullish on middle stump, clipped to deep backward square leg
down the track to the floaty offbreak outside off, and he gets into the perfect position to slog that with the turn and clear the deep midwicket boundary easily
length ball on middle and leg, clipped away to the right of deep square leg
fullish legcutter on off stump, driven back to the bowler
drops his length just a touch, on middle stump, and again Rohit clears his front leg and heaves it away over the midwicket boundary
slower ball outside leg, clipped to the left of short fine leg
slower ball turning from middle to off, pushed down the ground to long-on
slower ball on middle stump, clipped into the vacant midwicket region and Dhoni sprints quickly to the ball to keep Rohit down to one
quickish length ball outside off, gets on the front foot and pokes gently into the off side. Dhoni moves quickly to cut off thoughts of a single
length ball on middle stump, clipped away through square leg
back of a length outside off, no turn, beats Rohit's attempted cut
quickish, back of a length on off, tucked away through square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man
quickish again, a touch short on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
short ball, hurries onto Rayudu who scoops his pull high in the air off the high part of his bat. The ball drops safely to the right of long-on
again he's late on the pull, trying to fetch it from outside off, and the ball plops down softly in the mid-on region
back of a length on off stump, tucked away through square leg
short and wide, and Rayudu slashes it away easily, up and over backward point
short outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and works it through square leg
back of a length on leg stump, opens up for a push down the ground to long-on, but Ashwin moves to his right to cut it off
carrom ball, but it's a long hop, and Rohit pulls it fiercely to the square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, dabbed into the point region

gone! It was a flat, quick one that Rayudu didn't get to the pitch of as he ran down the track, and his miscued big hit settles into the hands of long-on. Rahane did well, moving to his right, keeping half an eye on the rope behind him, and settling into a nicely balanced position to take it at chest height with fingers pointing up
flighted and full on off stump, driven to long-on
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away into the square leg region
flat length ball outside off, reverse-swept to backward point
googly turning into off stump, a touch short, pulled to deep midwicket

short, wide legbreak, cut away to the right of a diving backward point fielder, and the man at sweeper cover moves to his left to clean up. That shot brings up yet another Rohit half-century in a chase
googly, maybe not as short as Rohit thought it was, and it skids on as he attempts to pull, and he bottom-edges towards short fine leg
tossed up outside off, driven back to the bowler
short and wide again, slapped away to the left of sweeper cover
please, please, lbw, please, how was that? Close, but Buttler was struck just outside the line of off stump, looking to reverse-sweep one that was too straight for the shot
on the stumps, worked away through square leg
back of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on
wide-ish yorker, jabbed to the right of short third man for a quick single
sees Buttler move away from leg stump and follows him with a slower ball - slower than what, exactly? - and he clips it down to long-on for one
slower leg-roller on middle stump, punched to long-on
back of a length close to off stump, whipped away through square leg
length ball on middle stump, and Buttler skips across his stumps, drops his right shoulder, and scoops the ball over the gap between keeper and short fine leg
slower ball, back of a length outside off, flat-batted to long-off
full and wide, and Rohit uses his hands so well, gets down low on the ball and eases it away to the right of backward point and far from the man at sweeper cover
slower short ball outside off, slapped towards backward point, and there's nearly a mix-up before Rohit finally decides to send Buttler back when he's halfway down the pitch
slower ball outside off, a bit fuller, and Rohit stabs it to the left of backward point
quickish low full-toss close to off stump, pushed to sweeper cover
googly turning from a good length outside off. Buttler picks it, gets nicely forward to clip it through midwicket
down the track, meets this straightish ball on the full and clips to the left of deep midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped to the right of long-on

down the track, and what wonderful hands Buttler has. There was a fraction of a second of stillness between his final stride and the moment his bat came swinging throigh the line, getting under the ball and lifting it effortlessly over the long-on boundary
length ball on middle and leg, whipped to long-on
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and pushes into the cover point region
short slower ball angling down leg. Rohit can't connect with the pull. Both bowler and keeper believe it clipped Rohit's glove before bouncing through to Dhoni
slower bouncer outside off, Rohit can't connect with the attempted ramp over short third man
sees Rohit walking across his stumps to target the fine leg region and fires in a yorker at his feet. He looks for the scoop, ends up edging it between his legs and finding the third man boundary
slower ball, shortish, looks for the pull and it rolls off his thigh into the backward square leg region
low full-toss outside off, flat-batted to long-off
full outside off, doesn't middle this hit over the covers and the ball lands and comes to a stop to the right of sweeper cover
full on the legs, clipped to deep square leg

what did that hit? Bouncer angling into the batsman, and he misses the hook and it pings off the top of his helmet to backward point. Dinda thought it came off the bat and was surprised to see Boland throw the ball towards the stumps at the bowler's end after catching the ball
bam! That was full on middle and leg, and he came forward, planting his front foot next to the line of the ball to enable a smooth, straight batswing and hit it back over the bowler's head
full on the legs, and Rohit flicks it over midwicket and easily finds the boundary to the right of long-on
slower length ball on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
low full-toss outside off, not too wide outside off, but it's enough room for Buttler to play a flat-bat drive, all wrists, and beat long-off easily to his left
shortish on middle and off, pulled down the ground to long-on
down the track and Ashwin bowls a quickish one, straighter and shorter than Buttler would like, and he clips quietly through midwicket
a bit of flight outside off and Rohit gets down low and slog-sweeps it high over the leg side to seal Mumbai's third straight win
